summary: This bill, the 'Making Insulin Affordable for All Children Act', aims to lower insulin costs for individuals aged 26 and under with private health plans. It mandates that plans cover 'selected insulin products' without deductibles and with cost-sharing capped at $35 or 25% of the negotiated price per 30-day supply. The bill amends existing healthcare laws (Public Health Service Act, ERISA, and the Internal Revenue Code) to implement these changes, encompassing definitions, rules of construction, and implementation guidelines. The changes apply beginning January 1, 2026.
